thread.title: High standard for an economy hotel Review
thread.title_full: High standard for an economy hotel - Review of Phoenix Hotel, London, England - TripAdvisor

author: FGrantWhittle
title: High standard for an economy hotel Review
text:
I just spent a week here, and I give it five stars within its class. It's not the Savoy or anything, but it was a great experience for an economy hotel.
My single room was, shall we say, a model of efficiency. I did not expect a vast room for a twin, and I did not get one, but it had everything I needed, including a nice fan (no AC, but it was March after all), a bed, a bath, and a place to put my things.
The room was kept up nicely the entire week, and was clean when I got there.
Unlike many budget hotels I have stayed in in London, this one was not charmingly threadbare. It had a nice level of finish in the rooms and in the public areas. It felt on par with a Hampton Inn in America.
I really enjoyed the included continental breakfast, which while not a traditional English breakfast (not really to my liking anyway) offered a nice variety, with toast, rolls, pain au chocolat, cheese, salami, boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, juices, etc. It was nice to be able to take advantage of this perk each morning before setting out.
The staff were unrelentingly friendly and helpful. The location was quite good, near Kensington Gardens, two tube stops on different lines, and plenty of neighborhood restaurants, pubs, and stores.
